intro: Platychorda applanata, commonly known as the flatleaf liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pterygopariaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. The plant has a thalloid structure, with a flat, ribbon-like body that is often covered in small, rounded structures called gemmae. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia located on the underside of its thallus. Platychorda applanata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
